credentials: PHD 2003 Univ of Maryland College Park
name: JONATHAN ECKHARDT

ratings.comment: I would not take this class if you need an entrepreneurship credit. Every class is just students giving presentations. The presentation also involves you having to know someone who is willing to share all the financial details about their company which makes it very difficult to do. Course material is rarely talked about in class and exams are hard

Just didn't love the class format for 422. You basically read and are examined only on the reading. Then, in class, every day is student presentations not having to do with exam material. Didn't work for me.

This class is definitely very interesting and very useful career-wise, but Jon's teaching method just doesn't work for me. You have to read the textbook on your own and every synchronous class is a student presentation. His lectures are all interviews with entrepreneurs and it feels quite sporadic.
One of my favorite professors at UW. Very practical guy that makes class entertaining while also making it centered around real world skills and useful information.

He is a very fair professor and the class is easy. I had a 100% until the final and the class is an easy A if you do the reading and attend lecture. I definitely recommend the class to anyone interested in entrepreneurship.
He tweaks out occasionally so get use to that but all and all a good professor

Eckhardt is a good professor. He lectures in an easy-to-understand style, and briefly covers a lot of topics. Nothing too in-depth, but interesting. Case studies, group project, one final exam. Not too hard a class, and if you like entrepreneurship, you'll enjoy it with Eckhardt.

Tries to pretend like he's nice and cares about you in class, but it's just a front. Really doesn't at all if you if you talk to him outside of lecture.  Honestly the way he teaches is pointless, as not much useful knowledge is learned and it's mostly common sense.
Jon is really good.  He teaches in a laid back manner and has a vast knowledge on entrepreneurship.
